title: MVC
contents: a pattern in software design commonly used to implement user interfaces, data, and controlling logic.

title: Object-oriented programming (OOP)
contents: a computer programming model that organizes software design around data, or objects, rather than functions and logic.

title: Object Relational Mapping (ORM)
contents: a technique used in creating a 'bridge' between object-oriented programs and, in most cases, relational databases. Put another way, you can see the ORM as the layer that connects object oriented programming (OOP) to relational databases
